ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.2_0: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan went to the house of a friend and sat down in private alone with his wife.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.3_0: The husband complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.4_0: “How can Venerable Upananda sit down in private alone with my wife?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.5_0: The monks heard the complaints of that person,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.7_0: “How can Venerable Upananda sit down in private alone with a woman?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.8_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.11_0: “... Foolish man, how can you sit alone with a woman on a private seat?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.13_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.14.1_0: ‘If a monk sits down in private alone with a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.6_0: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; one who understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.10_0: just the monk and the woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.12_0: there is private to the eye and there is private to the ear.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.14_0: one is not able to catch up or dirt while wounding, or to shout it with his head,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.16_0: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.18_0: if the monk sits down or lies down next to a seated woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.19_0: if the woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.20_0: If both are seated or both are lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.1_0: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.2_0: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.3_0: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.4_0: If he sits down in private alone with a female spirit, with a female ghost, with a _paṇḍaka_, or with a female animal in form, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.5_0: If it is not a woman, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.6_0: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.7_0: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.2_0: if he has a male companion who understands;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.3_0: if he stands and does not sit down;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.5_0: if he sits down preoccupied with something else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.7_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.8_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on sitting in private, is finished.
